headline: Is ExxonMobil's Upstream Profit Engine Still Running Strong?
summary: XOM aims to keep its upstream profits resilient by boosting low-cost production and cutting breakeven costs to $30 per barrel by 2030.

headline: AI’s Energy Crunch: 3 Hidden Winners That Will Profit From the Crisis
summary: The rapid rise of artificial intelligence (AI) is creating an unprecedented energy crisis in the U.S. As AI data centers proliferate to support advanced computing needs, their electricity consumption is projected to soar, potentially reaching 6.7% to 12% of the nation’s total power by 2028 — enough to power 24 million homes. This surge outpaces ... AI’s Energy Crunch: 3 Hidden Winners That Will Profit From the Crisis

headline: Global business leaders deliver climate action report to Brazilian authorities for COP30
summary: Press release Global business leaders deliver climate action report to Brazilian authorities for COP30 The SB COP30 Energy Transition working group, chaired by Solvay, outlines urgent actions and scalable solutions. Brussels, October 16, 2025 A coalition of global companies has delivered a landmark report on energy transition to Brazilian authorities ahead of COP30. The report, developed by the Sustainable Business (SB) COP30 Energy Transition Working Group in collaboration with McKinsey & Compa

headline: Equinor and Exxon Begin Production at Bacalhau Field in Brazil
summary: Equinor, ExxonMobil Brasil, and Petrogal Brasil have commenced production from the Bacalhau field in Brazil's Santos Basin, marking Equinor's largest international offshore development.

headline: Wind Turbine Lubricants Industry Analysis Report 2025-2029: Renewable Energy Expansion, Offshore Wind Development, and Technological Advancements in Turbine Efficiency
summary: This growth is driven by the global shift towards renewable energy, expanding wind power installations, and technological advancements in turbine design. Wind turbine lubricants, essential for maintaining turbines in harsh environments, are seeing increased demand, particularly in emerging markets. The market is segmented by product type, application, and base oil, with gear oil and synthetic base oils leading in their respective categories.
